summary:
Digital marketing and digital operations professional with 20+ years experience in:
• Online marketing strategy, digital marketing strategy
• Content strategy, content marketing
• Next best action/next best offer, marketing automation
• Data management (master data, meta data, ontology/taxonomy)
• Business intelligence, business analytics, digital analytics, social analytics, KPIs
• CMS selection, implementation, training
• Developing digital teams and organisational digital capabilities (increasing digital maturity)
• Budgeting, resource allocation, training and professional development

Key achievements:
• 2016 IAB's Thought Leadership initiative of the year
• Forrester recommendation for digital governance structure in Digital Customer Experience Governance Demystified (2013)
• 25th best global website in Byte level’s 2014 web globalisation report (global standards and user experience)
• 2014 CMA Silver Award for Best Use of Content Repurposing
• 2013, 2014 and 2015 IAB's Social Networking Champion
• 2013 ITSMA Marketing Excellence Award
• Forrester recommendation for best prof. services website in Best & Worst of B2B website design (2006)
• Deployed enterprise level marketing platform across 150 countries and 25 languages in 14 months.
• Implemented corporate/global digital strategy, standards and processes, and governance structures
• Implemented measurable improvements through optimized engagement strategies
• Realized cost savings through scalable operational efficiencies
• Balanced multiple demands for commitment of time and resources (budget and people)
• Motivated team members to work towards common goals, diversifying skill sets, delivering consistent results
• Adept at interacting effectively with peers, senior stakeholders (C-suite), clients and suppliers at all levels

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

education.field_of_study: Communications studies and Cultural productions and consumption

awards.title: 2016 IAB's Thought Leadership initiative of the year
awards.description: For the publication, Global CEO Outlook, jurors rewarded KPMG for an initiative which provides fresh insights on the state of business today and on the priorities CEOs are focused on as they look for future growth.  They branded the initiative as a resounding success both in 2015 and 2016 and as one of KPMG most successful initiatives. This is a very busy space of thought leadership and KPMG has found a niche that has been well received, jurors said. The innovative way it is delivered contributes to this success and it has been referenced in the global media.Indeed the reach of the initiative impressed jurors but looking forward they suggested that it might be interesting to expand not only to the view of the CEOs but also of the CFOs.

awards.title: 2015 IAB's Social Media Champion of the Year
awards.description: For a third consecutive year, KPMG International received an IAB award for social networking. IAB pointed to KPMG’s WEFLIVE service (www.WEFLIVE.com), which for a fourth year captured in real-time the Twitter conversations from delegates attending the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting in Davos, Switzerland.  IAB concluded that, “[t]his along with other social media initiatives demonstrated the [KPMG] network’s global impact in social networking.” (www.kpmg.com/socialmedia)

awards.title: 2014 CMA Silver Award for Best Use of Content Repurposing
awards.description: KPMG International was recognized by Content Marketing Awards (CMA) for WEFLIVE.com, with the Silver award for Best Use of Content Repurposing. The award recognized WEFLIVE’s ability to take large volumes of existing Twitter conversations around the World Economic Forum, and serve up insightful visualizations on the timely trends and stats on those global conversations.

awards.title: 2014 Summit Marketing Effectiveness Award, Category: Best of Social Media Marketing
awards.description: KPMG International received a Summit Marketing Effectiveness Award for Best of Social Media Marketing. This was the first year that KPMG has entered the WEFLIVE campaign for this award, and KPMG has been recognized for creating a truly interactive experience for its global audience, and for succeeding in generating brand awareness (exceeding objectives and surpassing last year’s performance). For more information, please visit the Summit International Awards website.

awards.title: 2014 IAB's Social Media Champion of the Year
awards.description: For a second consecutive year, KPMG International received an IAB award for social networking. IAB noted KPMG’s significant growth in its social media engagement across channels. It also pointed to the continued growth and enhancement of KPMG’s WEFLIVE service which for a third year captured in real-time the Twitter conversations from delegates attending the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting in Davos, Switzerland. For 2014, the WEFLIVE service was enhanced with improved filtering, search, and data visualization features.

awards.title: 2013 ITSMA Marketing Excellence Award
awards.description:
The award recognizes KPMG’s marketing campaign for the 2013 World Economic Forum (WEF) held in Davos.  The campaign was focused on the weflive.com service, an innovative Twitter aggregation service which distilled in real-time the Twitter conversations from Davos delegates, the media and Twitter users from across the world. 

ITSMA judges commended KPMG’s WEF campaign for:

Innovation – KPMG adopted an ‘outside-in’ campaign approach, using the weflive.com site to draw insights from real-time conversations of its audience and directly inform agile marketing and communications activities.

Focused execution – the integrated campaign entailed a technical build of weflive.com, kpmg.com/davos, internal comms and external PR, display advertising, Google Adwords, social media posts including sponsored tweets and use of KPMG’s on-site presence at Davos to engage with WEF delegates. 

Business results – the campaign achieved a total audience reach of 25 million people within a week, and a 60 percent competitive share of online voice, while weflive.com demonstrated the KPMG brand proposition of ‘Cutting through complexity’ by transforming vast amounts of information into insights with powerful filtering, search and data visualization features.

awards.title: 2013 IAB's Social Networking Champion (weflive.com)
awards.description:
The award for "Social Networking Champion" recognizes KPMG's WEFlive service, the innovative Twitter aggregation service that distilled in real-time the Twitter conversations from delegates attending the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting in Davos, Switzerland.  KPMG's Global Digital Marketing team expanded the capabilities of WEFlive for 2013, after a successful launch in 2012, achieving a even higher level of engagement at Davos this year, with tweets about the WEFlive site reaching an audience of 4.85 million people on Twitter. 

According to the IAB Awards judges, the WEFlive service showed great initiative, filtering through huge volumes of information to present only the most important insights along with powerful search and data visualization features, while also taking advantage of different social media platforms, including Twitter and Pinterest.

awards.title: 2013 Forrester's Digital Customer Experience Governance report
awards.description: In the Forrester report Digital Customer Experience Governance Demystified, KPMG is recommended for its' digital governance structure.

awards.title: 2011 Web Globalization Report Card
awards.description: Deloitte.com ranked 20th in ByteLevel Research's 2011 'Web Globalization Report Card'. Deloitte is the only professional services organization named in top 25.

awards.description:
100 Best websites in 2010, as selected by Management Team and WUA! based on consumer appreciation of the website. Deloitte.com ranked 38th: http://bit.ly/bV4VM7

WUA! also ranked Deloitte.nl as favorite amongst accountancy websites according to WUA Web Performance Scan 2010: http://bit.ly/cVbI8v

awards.title: 2010 Global by Design's Best global professional services website
awards.description: Global by Design named Deloitte.com as the best global professional services website in 2010: http://bit.ly/cwgTb5

awards.title: 2009 Frankwatching's Annual Review Recommendations
awards.description: Frankwatching commended Deloitte's online annual review for its sustainable and user fiendly character (due to personalisation options): http://bit.ly/2a1hSG

awards.title: 2006 Forrester: Best & Worst of B2B website design: Best professional services website
awards.description: Forrester: 'Best & Worst of B2B website design' - Deloitte.com rated as best professional services website, and one of only two sites to pass its review methodology. The report evaluated 16 B2B sites against 25 design criteria.

projects.title: World Economic Forum Live
projects.description:
Every year world leaders from business, politics and civil society gather in Davos, Switzerland for the annual summit of the World Economic Forum. www.weflive.com, is a Twitter aggregation service from KPMG International that distilled in real-time the Twitter conversations from Davos delegates. The site condensed overwhelming volumes of information to insights with powerful filtering, search and data visualization features:

•an enhanced ‘Pinterest’ style layout, that includes the ability to filter by content (e.g. articles, photos, video) included on tweets
•view real-time stats of activity, trending topics, and the most influential delegates 
•a real-time, interactive infographic that will compare ‘What delegates are saying’ alongside ‘What the world in saying’
•embeddable widgets for other websites  and blogs 

Public and media response to the site was very favorable and within just a few days, tweets about the site had reached an audience of almost five million people.

projects.description:
Created client and partner documentation to align measurement strategy to business and marketing strategy:
•Measurement scope, approach and methods
•Situation Analysis – Where Are You Today?
•Setting Objectives – Where Do You Want To Go?
•Strategy Setting – How To Get There?
•Tactical Planning – How To Implement Your Strategy?
•Your Action Plan – Assigning Roles and Deadlines (incl. measurement strategy/implementation schema)
•Staying In Control – Monitoring and Measuring Progress (incl. reporting/dashboard templates)

projects.description:
• Managed migration of 75+ sites (in Europe, Middle East and African region) to the upgraded Deloitte.com web platform (Vignette/OpenText CMS) 
• Created the documentation, training and support model for guiding member firm country digital teams through migration process, adoption of new technology/new design standards and launch of new websites.

profile_positions.title: Digital marketing & Next best action marketing specialist

profile_positions.description:
As Product Owner within a scrum team (business intelligence, business analytics and insights), I
• Engage with senior stakeholders in the stringent assessment of requests to the (digital) base team based on their business value and clear business issue description.
• Assess requests based on business value and required investment to deliver, and carry the responsibility (and accountability) to ensure only high-value requests make it to the product backlog.
• Am accountable for selecting the requests that make it to the sprint backlog (and thus will be delivered by the development team).
• Communicate with (senior) stakeholders about progress regarding their requests, planning and delivery time tables.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business KPIs into data-requirements and (future-proof)data models.
• Govern adherence to privacy legislation and guidelines (design with AVG/GDPR in mind).
• Contribute to performance management for both permanent staff and contractors on my team.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner Base (customer digital)

profile_positions.description:
• Online strategy for retention marketing / base marketing
• Online cross-sell and up-sell (base clients)
• Improve site effectivity and customer journeys (base clients)
• Assist deployment/improvement of marketing automation
profile_positions.title: Digital Marketing Specialist

profile_positions.description:
As Product Owner within a scrum team (business intelligence, business analytics and insights), I
•	Engage with senior stakeholders in the stringent assessment of requests to the data team based on their business value and clear business issue description. 
•	Assess requests based on business value and required investment to deliver, and carry the responsibility (and accountability) to ensure only high-value requests make it to the product backlog. 
•	Am accountable for selecting the requests that make it to the sprint backlog (and thus will be delivered by the development team). 
•	Communicate with (senior) stakeholders about progress regarding their requests, planning and delivery time tables.
•	Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business KPIs into data-requirements and (future-proof)data models.
•	Govern adherence to privacy legislation and guidelines (design with AVG/GDPR in mind).
•	Contribute to performance management for both permanent staff and contractors on my team.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner Data & Analytics

profile_positions.description:
•	Lead the operations management for KPMG International’s digital marketing technologies
•	Lead an international team of (18) digital experts responsible for campaigns, content publishing, social media, analytics and member firm support (centrally offered tools, standards and training).
•	Responsible for (multi-million) digital operations budget, provide insights into global digital marketing investment and “steady-state” budgets ($5-9M) and total cost of ownership of investments made (year-on-year commitments).
•	Working through senior level stakeholders (CMOs, national heads of digital) on global digital marketing initiatives and best practices, and how these benefit client engagement at the global or member firm level.
•	Lead the development and governance of organizational capabilities and competence in digital channels (digital maturity model), and the supporting technologies to operate and monitor them. 
•	Deliver key insights for the development of global digital marketing strategy, customer journey mapping, business requirements and user testing for platform development, and ensure process optimization and governance to reshape digital operations for greater efficiency and increased (digital) marketing impact.
•	Lead the development of digital marketing strategy and tactical plans.
•	Oversee delivery of global campaigns and content, driving engagement and conversion against key business deliverables, responsible for development of (owned and non-owned) global digital channels.
•	Supervise end-user experience testing, surveys and analytics to ensure channels meet end-user goals and business objectives. Unify data for registration, content and analytics for personalization/targeting. Align data and analytics reporting to customer journeys, conversions and KPIs through reporting dashboards.
•	Support development of ontology model to support data classification and standards to support manual classification and build intelligence for automated classification.
profile_positions.title: Head of global digital operations

profile_positions.description:
Ensure effective delivery of all global marketing digital campaigns and content marketing:
• Act as the lead digital contact for the global marketing team with responsibility for full end-to-end delivery of campaigns and content marketing that originate from global marketing and communications.
• Lead team responsible for online editorial, content publishing, SEO, analytics and member firm support, including offshore resources.
• Delivering high quality global digital marketing operations that benefit client engagement at global and member firm level.
• Development of global digital marketing strategy, business requirements and user testing for platform development, process optimization.
• Ensure digital channels meet and anticipate user goals and business objectives.
profile_positions.title: Senior manager global digital marketing

profile_positions.description:
Help clients to measure and evaluate online channels (incl. social media initiatives and mobile) and online marketing campaigns against business objectives and determine KPIs to make business decisions. Planning and implementation of measurement codes, advise on optimal use of reporting capabilities, evaluation and improvement of results, integration with online marketing tool. Working closely with client's web agency or online advisory firm to maximize results.

Portfolio of clients included: Nationale Nederlanden, Airmiles, ICS cards, CNV, UWV, Delta NV, International Bureau of Fiscal Documentation (IBFD), APG/ABP Pensioenfonds, Raad voor Rechtsbijstand, DUO, Agentschap NL, Belastingdienst, Binckbank, Colliers, Ministerie van Algemene Zaken, NPO, Royal Navy, See Tickets, SPE Luminus, SVB
